greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = smallest positive number, not a power of 2, that is not a substring of n in its binary representation.
comment: Similar to A261461, but if the smallest missing number is a power of 2, ignore it and look at the next-smallest missing number.
link: Hiroaki Yamanouchi, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10000
mathematica: fQ[m_, n_] := Block[{g}, g[x_] := ToString@FromDigits@IntegerDigits[x, 2]; StringContainsQ[g@ n, g@ m]]; Table[k = 3; While[Or[fQ[k, n] && k < 2 n, IntegerQ@ Log[2, k]], k++]; k, {n, 0, 86}] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Sep 21 2015 *)
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Sep 19 2015
